58501.name: Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer (Vol 2, Issue 6 - Jul 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Guns, Guns, Guns - Guerilla Warfare in the Aftermath
Head Trips, Mentalists in Avengers of Justice
A Long, Strange Trip... Part III
Sarge & the Boys, Battle Born Comic
58501.description:
Space Gamer #6 - July/August 1993
subtitled The Magazine of Free-Style Role-Play

Cover by John E. Holladn

Featured Game: Where Fools Dare to Tread

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

58502.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 40 - Jan 2007)
58502.description:
In this issue:


Babylon 5: Techno-Mage Prestige Classes


Turn your baldy wizard into a baldy illusionist, a baldy kung fu master or something even more esoteric with these prestige classes. A companion piece to the 2nd Edition Techno-Mage update from last issue.


RuneQuest: Arrows


Because there's more to archery than hiding at the back and shooting into melee with little regard for your companions' safety. A look at arrows both historical and fantastic for your RuneQuest games.


WARS: Weapons, Part 1


This month, we take a look at melee weapons, personal firearms, and a truly absurd variety of ammunition.


Glorantha: Gloranthan Goodies


Curios, oddities, and the occasional useful item that you may come across in a Gloranthan marketplace.


Lone Wolf: The Corruption of Ikaya, Part 2


The second part of our epic Lone Wolf adventure. This month, trek across the frozen wastes of Kalte and explore the ancient ice-fortress of Ikaya. Whatever you do, wrap up warm. Brr.

58503.name: Signs & Portents (Issue 73 - Oct 2009)
58503.description:
In this issue:


Strontium Dog


A selection of bounties, ready to be claimed.


Hammers Slammers


A complete scenario, with the players defending a village.


Fantasy Craft


A carnival to entertain your players.


Judge Dredd


The streets too easy for your Judges? Use these encounters to spice things up!


Conan


A complete adventure for 3rd-6th level characters, to kidnap the young daughter of a wealthy merchant!


Lone Wolf


The town of Ruanon uncovered!


Fantasy D20


Delving into the magic of the inner spheres.


Glorantha


A detailed look at the goblins of Genertela.


Traveller


Exploring the realms of psionic healing.


Babylon 5


Legacy of War, part 11 - the players must explore a lost colony for clues.

58504.name: Super Stocks
58504.description:
In Super Stocks three to four players compete to make the most money in stock market. The game takes about 90 minutes to complete. A 2009 Essen release, Super Stocks is an redevelopment of Fund Manager from year before.

The game play has not radically changed from Fund Manager. Players move one pawn around on a one way board using numbered tokens from one to three. Only after all players have used all of their tokens they become available to be used again. This constitutes one round, while the game is played for six or eight rounds for three or four players. Each turn the active player has to carry out the action where the pawn lands. These actions inluce buying & selling stocks in four companies, drawing an event card, or one of four more special actions.

Compared to Fund Manager in Super Stocks players have both more power to influence the stock prices and more tools to reduce randomness. There also is no need for pen & paper as Super Stocks comes with stock tiles.

58505.name: WARS Roleplaying Game
58505.description:
From the back of the book:

"It is the end of the 24th Century and the Solar System shudders with the drums of war. A rift in space has slashed across the system between the Asteroid Belt and Jupiter, and from this great wound in the universe have come invaders: the arrogant, wraithlike Shi and their enemies, the brutal Quay. But the rift brought with it something else - a strange quantum energy which has granted certain select individuals exotic powers, abilities never seen before in the history of humanity.

The Shi and the Quay do not face a united human race. Centuries of exploration and expansion, of disaster and disagreement, of misunderstanding, greed and acrimony have split humanity into three distinct camps, each already at the others’ throats when the rift changed the face of the Solar System forever.

Five factions now war for control of the Solar System. The Earthers, ruled by giant corporations; the Gongen, descendants of those who fled the radiation-scarred wastes of Asia for the red sands of Mars; the Mavericks, pirates and rogues of the Outer Rim; the Shi, imperialistic and domineering; and the Quay, tribal, brutal and proud.

This universe of conflict and power was introduced in the WARS Trading Card Game from Decipher. Now, you can step inside of it, becoming a character enveloped in the aggressive conflict.

From the sun-scarred plains of Mercury to the frigid vacuum of the Outer Rim, battles rage across the Solar System, some fought in the open with ships and soldiers, some fought in secret with spies and assassins. For now, the factions seem evenly matched, but no one knows how long that will last. A handful of determined people might change the tide; a few actions might determine the face of the Solar System for millennia to come.

Are you up to the challenge? Then welcome to WARS."

58506.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 42 - Mar 2007)
58506.description:
In this issue:


WARS: Bots


From robotic vermin-exterminators to automated bartenders to giant war machines from the '20 seconds to comply' school of artificial intelligence design, WARS is replete with animate machines. Here are full game statistics for a representative selection.


Lankhmar: Loot


Because there's always one: the Player Character who can't resist dipping his hand into passing pockets. We present several interesting and unique items that might be found through casual thievery. Although written with Lankhmar in mind, these tables can be used for any setting.


Babylon 5: Conversion Guide, Part 3


This month, Bryan Steele covers converting your character's feats and skills from 1st edition to 2nd edition.


Babylon 5: Earth Alliance Special Forces, Part 2


Guns, grenades, guns, bombs, guns, vehicles, guns, spaceships and guns. The cutting-edge hardware of EarthForce's most elite troops.


RuneQuest: Tors and Tombs


A scenario for RuneQuest featuring mysterious violent deaths, suspicious raids on sacred ground, a druid, and a troll.

58507.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 43 - Apr 2007)
58507.description:
In this issue:


Glorantha: Twenty Gloranthans


A selection of pre-statted Non-Player Characters for those moments when your players want to know who they have bumped into on the road, or when they have unexpectedly antagonised a Praxian bison rider.


WARS: Cybernetics


We can rebuild him. We have the technology. We can make him better... stronger... faster. Upgrade your Maverick characters with these cybernetic and biotechnological enhancements.


OGL: Masked Monsters


Six creatures that use methods magical and mundane to confound expectations. Exceptionally useful for antagonising players who know all the monster stats off by heart.


Roleplaying: Improving Riddles and Puzzles


A short but insightful look into the nature of riddles and puzzles in roleplaying, along with several samples in case you need a cryptic pronouncement at short notice.


RuneQuest: Vignettes


Four short-but-sweet mini-adventures ideal for filling a spare hour or expanding into full-blown scenarios.


Babylon 5: The Doppelganger Trap


A mysterious mission, a mysterious derelict and a mysterious prisoner all conspire to spell trouble in this Babylon 5 scenario.

58508.name: Carnival
58508.description:
From the Back of the Book:
A carnival offers a glimpse of abnormal and unnatural things most genteel folk never talk about, much less see. This carnival is not a simple sideshow, though, and its performers are far more than freaks on display. Carnival is a wandering haven for those who have no place else to go--including adventurers who made enemies of the wrong people. Under the protection of its mysterious mistress Isolde, it offers refuge to those rejected by the world. Outcasts and lost souls of all kings can find solace here, and sometimes even a second chance at life... but nothing at Carnival comes without a price.

This accessory draws back the curtain on dark secrets that will enrich any AD&D campaign with a touch of the bizarre and horrific. Included are over a dozen richly details nonplayer characters, details on "the price" that Carnival exacts from those who travel with it, and story seeds to lure unsuspecting heroes into a web of mystery and trickery.

58509.name: Champions of the Mists
58509.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Designed for use by Dungeon Masters and players alike, Champions of the Mists greatly expands upon the role of heroes on the Demiplane of Dread. Inside are many exciting new options:

- More than a dozen new character kits (such as guardians, Knights of the Shadows, and psychic) designed to give new and existing Ravenloft heroes a flavor all their own.

- Complete game statistics for many characters from the Ravenloft novels, including Larissa Snowmane (Dance of the Dead), Ivan Dragonov (Mordenheim), and Brother Dominic (Tapestry of Dark Souls).

- Roleplaying guidelines and tips to make Ravenloft characters different from their counterparts in other ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS campaign settings.

- Long-awaited game statistics and biographical information about some of the Demiplane's greatest heroes, including Alanik Ray, George Weathermay, and the land's greatest Avenger, Gondegal of the Circle.

- Rules for using firearms in the Land of the Mists.

58510.name: The Shadow Rift
58510.description:
From the Back of the Book:
For many years folk have gazed into the churning black vapors of the Shadow Rift and wondered at the horrors that might lie within. Some have speculated that it might be a realm of the doomed, where tortured spirits suffer the hours of eternity. Others have speculated that it might be an empty domain, waiting for the arrival of a master who is evil enough to claim it and shape it in his own image. Even the mysterious Vistani do not know what secrets are hidden in the depths of this gaping chasm.

Now, the time has come for the veil of shadows to be parted. Loht, king of the shadow elves, has reclaimed the mighty Sword of Arak. With this relic, he intends to set in motion a plan that has taken thousands of years to form. He will throw open that very gate of darkness and invite one of mankind's greatest enemies to walk the land of the living.

And if he is not stopped, the rivers of Ravenloft will run red with the blood of the innocent.

This adventure can be played independently or in conjunction with the RAVENLOFT adventure Servants of Darkness.

For four to six characters of levels 7-9

58511.name: Servants of Darkness
58511.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Young Bryonna has been judged guilty of consorting with the dark forces of Tepest, and now she will burn at the stake for it. The Inquisitors, priests whose zealousness sometimes stirs whispers of doubt among the people, have condemned her with all the surety that comes with their "holy" power.

Heroes of integrity and justice are needed to ferret out the truth. To success, they must travel a perilous path that winds through the labyrinthine tunnels of Mount Lament and leads them to the dreaded Hags of Tepest and Tristessa the banshee. Worse still, they must ultimately face the mysterious Prince of Shadows, who manipulates the denizens of the domain for his own evil purposes. When to stand fast? When to run? Only those who survive can say.

Servants of Darkness is a stand-along adventure that can also lead the party to investigate the misty chasm at the center of the Demiplane's Core in the The Shadow Rift, the next release for the RAVENLOFT campaign setting.

For four to six characters of levels 4-6.

58512.name: The Gamer (Issue 4 - Jul 1992)
58512.description:
Contents

Leading Off
Letters
The Soapbox
The Board Room
News & Notes
Convention Report

The Meat Of The Order
Featured Review: Al-Qadim
Live-Action Roleplaying, Part 2
The Electronic Gamer
"Greg, You Ignorant Slut..."
Cover Story: Summer Convention Preview
One-Page Review: Total War
One-Page Review: Battlelords of the 23rd Century
One-Page Review: Laser Grenadiers
One-Page Review: Minion Hunter

Hitting Cleanup
Contest
Roll Dem Bones: Why Games Cost What They Do, Part II
Classifieds
Bulletin Board
Capsule Reviews

58513.name: Cyberpunk 2020: Sul filo del rasoio
58513.description: "Cyberpunk 2020 - Sul filo del rasoio" is the Italian version of Cyberpunk 2020, except that it only comprises chapters 1 to 10 of the original English language edition. The remaining five chapters were published as a separate supplement, with the title "Hardware".

58515.name: Space Fleet: Warp Two
58515.description:
The expansion of Space Fleet - Warp One. It's a tactical starship wargame.The tactical level uses counters or miniatures to represent individual starships in combat. The playing area is a hex sheet that you supply.
Space Fleet - Warp Two includes strategic campaign rules, technology advancement, and the advanced rules.

58517.name: Terra Primate
58517.description:
From the back of the book:

Nothing like a rifle butt to the kidneys to prove that you're awake – that this isn't just some horrible nightmare. You'd reach out to stop your face from slamming into the dust but your arms are chained and shackled.

You roll over, the boots of the guard stamping close to your head. "Get up, slave," it shouts. An ape, speaking English.

Still, you've seen far stranger things since arriving here. Now, if only you could escape. But where would you go? The entire planet is populated by intelligent, psychotic and dangerous primates.

From the company that brought you aliens, witches and zombies, Terra Primate is a complete roleplaying game of intelligent apes. In it, you will find:

- Nine different Apeworld settings to make each campaign unique;
- A comprehensive intelligent ape creation system, for players and Ape Masters;
- Detailed creation rules for Pre-Heroic, Heroic and Powered characters;
- The full Unisysistem rule mechanics, useful for any game in any time period;
- A list of equipment useful for surviving, escaping or even ruling an Apeworld.

58518.name: George's Children
58518.description:
From the back of the book:

George's Children is a roleplaying game by Jon Hodgson and Jim Pinto detailing the lives of children living in a post-apocalyptic world devoid of adults. Taking place over the course of a single day in the childrens' lives, the game provides players with a story environment rich in potential, without the need of a Game Master.

The tone is dark, the themes complex, and the gameplay unlike anything you've experienced before.

Welcome to the future of George's Children.

100% of the proceeds from the sale of this book will go to charity to aid abandoned and abused children.

58519.name: TWRS
58519.description:
TWRS is a strategy game for 2 players, which can be played in about twenty minutes. The game board consists of a grid of 11x11 lines. Playing takes place on the lines of intersection (like Go).

Each player possesses three towers (hence TWRS). Each turn you must move one of them. You can move a tower horizontally or vertically, as far as you wish. You can't jump over other playing pieces however.

After this, you can "activate" the tower you moved to place marking stones on the game board. You try to use these to lessen the freedom of movement of your opponent's towers. But they also lessen the freedom of movement of your own towers!

Chains of marking stones can wall off parts of the game board. Play ends when every walled off area is occupied only by towers of one player.

The player that possesses the largest part of the game board wins.

TWRS is published in a limited edition of 265 pieces. This collector's edition comprises blown glass pieces and a stainless steel box and game board.

58520.name: Prince of Undeath
58520.description:
From the Publisher: This epic-level D&D adventure is designed to take characters from 27th to 30th level. In this adventure, the demon lord Orcus tries to usurp the Raven Queen’s power over death using a shard of evil plucked from the depths of the Abyss. Only the world’s most powerful heroes have the slightest hope of stopping him.

This adventure can be played as a stand-alone adventure or as the conclusion of a three-part series that spans 10 levels of gameplay.

58521.name: A Pilot's Guide to the Caledon Subsector
58521.description:
This supplement by J. Andrew Keith was submitted to GameLords but never published. An abridged version (with inaccurate maps) was previously published in Traveller Chronicle. This product was first available in full on the FASA and Gamelords Licensed Traveller CD-ROM. It has been compiled to look as much like it would have been pubvlished by Gamelords as possible based on the model of A Pilot's Guide to the Drexilthar Subsector, including GameLord logo's on the covers, only the copyright has been credited to FFE 2009.

From the back of the book:

From the astrogational computers of the Imperium comes A Pilot's Guide to the Caledon Subsector, a detailed examination of a single subsector on the frontier of the Imperium. Caledon... dominated by the Principality of Caledon, lies at the very center of Reaver's Deep Sector. Each world in the subsector is explored in sufficient depth to be the setting for one or more specific adventures int he Traveller universe. Planetary data on each world is also of use in conjunction with the GameLords enviromental supplements: Undersea, Desert, and Mountain.

Come explore the Traveller universe... with A Pilot's Guide to the Caledon Subsector.

58522.name: Primal Power
58522.description:
From the publisher:

New options for barbarians, druids, shamans, and wardens

Take a walk on the wild side! This must-have book is the latest in a line of player-friendly game supplements offering hundreds of new options for D&D characters, specifically focusing on heroes who draw power from the spirits that preserve and sustain the world. It provides new archetypal builds for barbarians, druids, shamans, and wardens, including new character powers, feats, paragon paths, and epic destinies.

58523.name: Draconomicon: Metallic Dragons
rpgissuearticle: Design & Development - Genesis of a Monster
58523.description:
From the publisher:

Draconomicon: Metallic Dragons describes several varieties of dragons, including gold, silver, copper, iron, and adamantine dragons. It also introduces several other kinds of metallic dragons suitable for any D&D campaign.

This supplement presents dragons both malevolent and benign, and gives details on each dragon’s powers, tactics, myths, lairs, servitors, and more. In addition, this book provides new information about the roles that metallic dragons fill in a D&D game. Story and campaign elements in the book give Dungeon Masters ready-to-play material that is easily incorporated into a game, including adventure hooks, quests, encounters, and pregenerated treasure hoards.

58524.name: I.S.C.V. King Richard
58524.description:
From an advertising description:

The King Richard is a luxury ship of the first class and is known across the galaxy. The ship contains casinos, pools, dining rooms, etc. Her 5,000 tons hold 200 staterooms.

Cover and interior art: William H. Keith Jr.

58525.name: Double Cross
58525.description:
From the publishers website:

Mr. Johnson has some serious personal problems with a certain corporate executive. He would like for you to help in reducing these problems - permanently...

58526.name: Strings Attached
58526.description:
From the publishers website:

You're hired to extract some VIPs from a secure facility and then destroy any evidence or witnesses that you were there. Of course, there are strings attached: the VIPs are not very cooperative and must be unharmed. You always did enjoy a challenge!

58527.name: Harvest Time
58527.description:
From the publishers website:

The members of an urban tribe are brutally murdered and left for dead. Who could do such a thing? Vampires, ghouls, gangs, or just some crazed lunatic? Nope, a greedy corporation that needs fresh organs! Help recover the evidence before it is destroyed and stop them!

58528.name: The Gambler
58528.description:
From the publishers website:

An opportunity for a payday! Your fixer lets you know that a client is looking for a datasteal in a previously scouted location. Get in, get the paydata, and get out, all without leaving a trace or a trail of destruction. Know when to hold 'em and know when to fold 'em.

58530.name: Creatures, Clothed in Strangeness
58530.description:
A second 'Peculiar book' for Nobilis, containing: rules and example templates for a variety of fantastic and supernatural (and some more mundane) beasts; and rules dealing with clothing, jewelry, and other sartorial accoutrements.

It was released on the designer's website and is available at

http://imago.hitherby.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/creatur...

58537.name: Mondo Novo "Een Wereldspel"
58537.description:
A Dutch worldgame with 1200 questions and 600 hints.

The player who is the first to be present on all continents with pawns of his own colour wins the game.

In this game players roll the die, move their pawn and answer the question correct to move again. To get a pawn on one of the continents you get a hint/characteristic of a country and you have to guess the country the hint refers to.

58538.name: Grand Fleets II
58538.description:
From the publishers website

Grand Fleets II is a miniatures game of naval warfare during the age of the battleship. From the ironclads of the late 1800s to the super-dreadnoughts of World War II, players can take command of the ships that altered the course of history.

Great pains have been taken to accommodate a wide range of preferences: hexes or no hexes; any miniatures scale; simultaneous or sequential play. The choices are up to you!

In addition to the basic rules for surface actions between 1890 and 1940, Grand Fleets includes advanced rules for things like time of day, smokescreens, crew quality, and destroyer flotillas. Best of all, you'll never have to wait for "official" publication of your favorite ships: comprehensive, step-by-step guidelines are provided to generate data cards for any vessel that put to sea during the battleship era.

So, raise the battle ensign, sound general quarters, and damn the torpedoes! your destiny awaits!

58539.name: Lost Souls Eternal
58539.description: Adventure description from front page "You find yourselves in a race against time and the servants of an ancient foe with an island of ill-repute as your destination. Your mission is to discover, and return with, what your rivals wish to obtain... if you can. Fighters, clerics and diplomats are highly recommended. Not recommended for those with a fear of the sea or a dislike for water. An adventure for characters of Average Party Level 6 through 14."

58540.name: Ratpack
58540.description:
Subtitle: A game of suburban survival

Publisher's description:

Ratpack is a roleplaying game where the players portray rats living in the crawlspaces and cupboards of your average American suburban home. Each game session is based around a "mission" (usually involving food, people and household pets). The default play style is a fun, adventure-filled romp - like a cross between The Dirty Dozen and Goodfellas (except with rats as the protagonists).

58541.name: Revenge of the Giants
58541.description:
From the Back of the Book:
Earth giants, frost giants, fire giants... when the giants strike out to raid and destroy the civilized lands, it becomes apparent that something much larger and more dangerous lurks in the background. A group of adventurers must locate the spark that has ignited this spreading fire and find a way to snuff it out before it engulfs the world.

Revenge of the Giants is a super-length adventure that takes characters from 12th level to 17th level. It includes background material, adventure hooks, new monsters and magic items, and a powerful, unfolding story that shows off the best of the paragon tier of play. It also includes a double-sided battle map depicting key encounter sites, designed for use with D&D Miniatures.

58542.name: Campaign
58542.description:
Not to be confused with the identically named game produced by Waddingtons in the 1970's (geek ID 1964).

Campaign is a board wargame produced by Wills and Hepworth in Loughborough, United Kingdom. The company is better known for producing the "Ladybird" range of childrens books.

The game components are:

2 x sets of cardboard 4 artillery pieces (one red set, one blue set)
2 x sets of cardboard 4 tank pieces (one red set, one blue set)
2 x sets of cardboard 6 infantry pieces (one red set, one blue set)
1 x six sided dice
1 x playing board
1 x rules leaflet

It is a game for 2 players, but it can be played with 2 or even 3 players on each side. Each side has 4 units of tanks, 4 units of artillery and 6 infantry units. The object of the game is to reach the opposing sides base with one of each unit type (tank, artillery and infantry).

58543.name: WARS Incursion
58543.description:
From the back of the book:

"WARS Incursion is the first adventure scenario published for the WARS Roleplaying Game and is designed for a group of 2nd level characters. It is designed to introduce players and Games Masters alike to the exciting and vibrant WARS campaign setting, and to serve as a starting point for the campaign and the careers of the Player Characters.

In Incursion, the Player Characters find themselves caught up in a web of betrayal, revenge and deception ranging throughout the Outer Rim and threatening to set the entire Solar System ablaze. From the creaking, dripping Cellar of Themis Station to the brutal cold of space and the ruined bridge of an enormous derelict battleship, the Player Characters will pick their way through a plotline rife with danger but with very few clear paths. They might make and break alliances, turn enemies to their side or find themselves staring down the barrel of a gun."

58544.name: WARS Battlefront
58544.description:
From the back of the book:

"It is a big Solar System, too big to be contained in a single rulebook. Though the WARS Rulebook contains everything a Games Master or a player absolutely needs to play a WARS Roleplaying Game campaign, Battlefront takes things a few giant leaps further.

Within the pages of this book, meant for Games Masters and players alike, readers will find a wealth of information to deepen and enrich their WARS campaigns.

Battlefront contains an in-depth look at each of the factions, detailing the Earthers, Gongen, Mavericks, Quay and Shi as never before, including background and cultural information on each, as well as tips and strategies for creating a mixed-faction group of Player Characters.

Those looking for more options and alternatives for characters will find a treasure of new prestige classes and kizen abilities to give Player Characters an extra edge or give Non-Player Characters a few hidden and unpleasant surprises to spring on the Player Characters themselves.

The WARS Roleplaying Game is not bound to a single planet or moon - rather, the plotlines and Player Characters tend to range throughout the Solar System. Battlefront offers an enormous section on the Solar System itself, detailing the background and physical aspects of each of the planets, as well as major moons, asteroids and even space stations. From the surface temperature of Mercury to the necessary escape velocity of Charon, from the penal colonies of Io to the boomtowns and brush wars of Titan, this exhaustively researched section of Battlefront holds all the answers. The section on travel in the Solar System brings it all together, giving Games Masters rules and guidelines for determining how long a trip from Earth to Europa will take, or how much time is required for a transmission from Gongen to reach Ceres.

Packed with even more information, Battlefront is an invaluable addition to any WARS Roleplaying Game campaign."

58545.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 44 - May 2007)
58545.description:
In this issue:


Tales From Mongoose Hall


This month: how to write an adventure that will survive contact with the Player Characters.


Conan: Noble Followers


You’ve just got the Leadership feat - what sort of lackeys and minions should you get? Find the answers here.


RuneQuest: Spirits


Incorporeal creatures to confuse Player Characters with and broaden your options for immaterial encounters.


OGL: Ailments and Contagions


A selection of diseases that range from irritating to epidemic in scope.


WARS: Equipment


From magnetic boots to power cells to a space-hut in a box - nonspecific equipment for WARS.


OGL Wild West: Deadwood


Learn about the residents of the most famous town in the Old West.


Conan: The Horror in Numalia


Fight animated statues, rescue a beautiful woman and face off against a powerful demon in this adventure.


Glorantha: My Brother's Feast


Fight trollkin, loot their meagre treasures, and face off against an ancient mostali construct in this RuneQuest scenario.

58547.name: The Gamer (Issue 4.5 - Aug 1992)
58547.description:
A special issue given out at GenCon/Origins 1992.

While it was supposed to be a subset of issue #4 with a special "The Soapbox" column by Scott Haring, many of the reviews didn't run until issue #5

58548.name: Crucible of Pain
58548.description:
From the back:
A beautiful woman at the mercy of a madman ... a creature from Orrorsh that preys on fear ... a Nile experiment gone horribly wrong, which threatens all with a fate far worse than death.

58549.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 45 - Jun 2007)
58549.description:
In this issue:


Spycraft: How To Wrestle Three Tigers


Two of the masterminds behind Spycraft consider the genesis of the new game, and where it might go from here.


Elric and Hawkmoon


An overview of the Worst Kept Secret In Roleplaying - our new Eternal Champion licences.


OGL: Books - The Other Treasure


Because there’s more to valuable writing than the runic inscriptions on your vorpal sword.


RuneQuest: Spirit Invocation


Got something strange in your neighbourhood? Exorcise it! Or, better yet, bind it and force it to serve you!


The World According to Roleplaying


This month, the farcical death of William the Conqueror.


WARS: Jetpacks


Finally, a use for the Operate Jetpack skill. Jink! Turn! Strafe your enemies! Just watch out for that tree...


Conan: The Scarlet Citadel


Who would live in a house like this? Take a wander around one of the most famous homes in Conan canon.


RuneQuest: Down The Hatch!


In a nod to one of the oldest tropes of fantasy roleplaying, we examine booze for RuneQuest.


Lone Wolf: Sorcerer of the Right Hand


A new character class for the Lone Wolf RPG. For villains only!


RuneQuest: Enchanted Arcana


A handful of magic items with step-by-step instructions for their creation.

58550.name: The Gamer (Issue 5 - 1992)
58550.description:
Contents

Leading Off
Letters
The Soapbox
The Board Room
News & Notes
Convention Report

The Meat Of The Order
Featured Review: Dangerous Journeys
GenCon/Origins Report
Hall of Fame Profile: Sandy Petersen
Cover Story: Games To Books
The Electronic Gamer
One-Page Review: Road To The White House
One-Page Review: Castle of Magic

Hitting Cleanup
Contest
Roll Dem Bones: What Those Credits Mean, Part I
Sales Chart
Classifieds/Bulletin Board
Capsule Reviews

User Commentary

The last issue in the traditional magazine format. Also did not have a month on the masthead — just the year.

58551.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 46 - Jul 2007)
rpgissuearticle: Owning the Worlds Where You Live
58551.description:
In this issue:


The World According To Roleplaying


How the Titanic was sunk... if roleplayers did it.


WARS: Ships, Part 1


Rules for ship maintenance and stats for capital ships should your players be foolish enough to steal one.


Conan: Mount Yimsha


A guide to Mount Yimsha, its surroundings and inhabitants. Watch out for those acolytes...


RuneQuest: Living Magic


When you want to throw your players a curve, try a magic item with a mind of its own.


Spycraft: Owning the Worlds Where You Live


Patrick Kapera and Scott Gearin present a campaign setting that makes full use of Spycraft’s flexibility.


Spycraft: Tournaments and Island Lairs


A preview of the Martial Artist core class from the upcoming Crafty Games release, World on Fire.


RuneQuest: The Quest for the Stones


Fight treacherous trolls and gribbly goblins in this adventure for experienced RuneQuest characters.

58552.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 47 - Aug 2007)
rpg: Slaine: The Roleplaying Game of Celtic Heroes
58552.description:
In this issue:


B5: Aliens


A quartet of alien races that were chopped from the book Heroes and Aliens due to lack of space.


Slaine: Fomorian Lords


A sneak preview of one of the big nasties from the forthcoming RuneQuest Sláine.


Glorantha: Blood of Orlanth


An overview of the awesome new Glorantha campaign by its author, Gareth Hanrahan.


The World According to Roleplaying


The almost-true story of Dr. Crippen and his wacky getaway scheme.


WARS: Ships, Part 2


Last month we looked at the capital ships. This month, ships more suitable for Player Characters: freighters, scouts and fighters.


Conan: The Vault of Thedipides


To go with the release of Conan Second Edition, an adventure for a group of 1st-level characters.


RuneQuest: Hunter’s Spoils


Several unique creatures and the goodies that can be harvested from their bodies.


Spycraft: And... Action!


Two of the creators of Spycraft 2.0 take a look at how to emulate big-screen blockbusters in your games.

58553.name: The Gaunt Man Returns
58553.description:
From the back:
The near now. Two years ago, a band of intrepid Storm Knights trapped the Gaunt Man within a powerful reality storm. Now the master of the horror realm of Orrorsh, the most powerful High Lord of all, is back!

58554.name: Dungeons & Dragons Basic Game
rpgpodcastepisode: The Save or Die Podcast: Interview with Frank Mentzer
58554.description:
From the Back of the Box:
ENTER A WORLD OF ADVENTURE AND IMAGINATION

Become a Hero
Take on the role of a fierce warrior, a mighty sorcerer, a powerful cleric, or a stealthy rogue and embark on a heroic quest.

Brave the Unknown
Explore the treacherous dungeons, battle terrifying monsters, and discover wondrous treasures.

Bring Your Friends
Together with your bold companions, prove you've got what it takes to face the risks and collect the rewards in the greatest fantasy roleplaying game of all time.

Also listed on BoardGameGeek as Dungeons & Dragons Basic Game

58555.name: Dungeons & Dragons Basic Game (revised)
rpgpodcastepisode: The Save or Die Podcast: Interview with Frank Mentzer
58555.description:
From the Back of the Box:
ENTER A WORLD OF ADVENTURE AND IMAGINATION

Become a Hero
Take on the role of a fierce warrior, a mighty wizard, a powerful cleric, or a stealthy rogue and embark on a heroic quest.

Brave the Unknown
Explore dangerous dungeons, fight terrifying monsters, and discover wondrous treasures.

Bring Your Friends
Together with your bold companions, prove you've got what it takes to face the risks and collect the rewards in the greatest fantasy roleplaying game of all time.

Everything you need to start playing now!
- 12 painted miniatures (heroes and monsters)
- 4 double-sided dungeon tiles
- 4 hero booklets
- 1 Dungeon Master booklet
- 6 dice
- 1 counter sheet
- 1 advanced rulebook

58556.name: High Lord of Earth
58556.description:
From the back:
The Near Now. As the Possibility Wars rage across the globe, Storm Knights valiantly battle the High Lords of the six invading realms. Now a new threat has arisen - one which may lead to the creation of a deadly seventh realm, and the final doom of Core Earth.

58557.name: Ares (Special Edition 1 - Summer 1983)
rpgissuearticle: Dawn of the Dead game variant
rpg: Universe: The Role-Playing Game of the Future (1st & 2nd Editions)
58557.description:
From the table of contents:

White Hole Bomb - Science Fact (By Curtis L. Johnson)
Conan the Barbarian - Synopsis (By L. Sprague de Camp)
The Oaken Sword - Fiction (By Ian Mcdowell)
Nitimandrey and the Cabinet-Maker's Vision - Fiction (By Jessica Amanda Salmonson
Dawn of the Dead - Game Variant (By Edward Bever)
First Contacts - A Universe Supplement

58558.name: Player's Kit
58558.description:
From the Back of the Box:
THE MAGIC OF D&D IS IN YOUR HANDS!

Create Characters
Imagine the exact characters you want to play, then build them -- choosing from 7 races, 11 classes, and hundreds of skills and feats and spells.

Test Your Skills
Play through the Solo Adventure to see what your new character can do.

Explore a World of Options
Delve into your own copy of the D&D Player's Handbook, which contains everything a player needs to get into the full D&D game experience.

Create your own D&D characters now!
- Premium D&D Dice Set
- 1 Quick-Start Character Creation booklet
- 1 Quick-Start Rules Summary booklet
- 1 Solo Adventure booklet
- 1 Character Sheet
- 1 soft-cover D&D Player's Handbook

58559.name: The Cassandra Files
58559.description:
From the back:
The Near Now. As the Possibility Wars rage across the globe, Core Earth United States has come under the control of the Delphi Council, a special task force made up of scientists, military leaders, and corporate heads. These men and women hold the nation in an iron grip - and now, their secret files are open to you.

58560.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 39 - Nov 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Law and Wizards in Fantasy Roleplaying
Night of Rage - A Monkey-Wrenching story for Werewolf: The Apocalypse
The Things I'll do for a Friend
Tools for the Masquerade - Schere's Disease
58560.description:
From the table of contents:

Runes (By Ken Cliffe)
From the Pack
Industry Wired (By Travis Williams)
The White Wolf EAC (By Lyndi McKeeman)
Howling at the Moon (By Travis Williams)
Out of Character - Mark Rein-Hagen (By James A. Moore)

The Powers of the Past - Traveller:The New Era (By John W. Vogel)
Night of Rage - Werewolf (By Sam Chupp)
The Things I'll Do for a Friend (By Stewart Wieck)
Paradox Flawed (A.K.A. "Oops!") - Errata for Mage (By Phil Brucato)

Law and Wizards in Fantasy Roleplaying (by Steven S. Long)
Feature Review: Kult (By Denys Bakriges)
Tools for the Masquerade - Vampire (By Alara Rogers)
Treasures from the Archives - Ship deck plans (by Ken Rolston)

Artist Spotlight: Jeff Laubenstein
The Silicon Dungeon (By Jim Trunzo)
Capsule Reviews
Legacy Rite, Episode 1 of 6 (By Bill Bridges)

58561.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 48 - Sep 2007)
rpg: Slaine: The Roleplaying Game of Celtic Heroes
58561.description:
In this issue:


Tales From Mongoose Hall


The tales that put the ‘feet’ in ‘feature’ and the ‘pie’ in ‘inspiring’ are back! How wrong can one campaign go?


Welcome Home, Weary Traveller...


An overview of the new version of Traveller by the man at the top of the heap, Matthew Sprange.


Meet The Editors


Ever wondered what sort of person edits roleplaying books for a living? Well, this article probably won’t help you.


RuneQuest: Alternative Elementals


Eight unusual elementals based on non-classical elemental configurations.


The World According to Roleplaying


This month, the mutiny on the Bounty.


Sláine: A Wager Lost


A short adventure for the new RuneQuest Sláine. As played at GenCon UK!


WARS: Vehicles


Whether you are flying or driving, this article has got what you need. That is, cars and aircraft.


RuneQuest: Bad Dreams


A nice hotel, a monastery full of lepers and madmen, and strange magic afoot in this RuneQuest adventure.

58562.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 49 - Oct 2007)
rpgissuearticle: The Pits Where Mad Things Drum
rpg: Slaine: The Roleplaying Game of Celtic Heroes
58562.description:
In this issue:


Spycraft: Owning the Gear You Carry


Agonising over the gear choices for your Spycraft character? No longer!


Dredd: Call-Me-Robot


Ways to use robots in your Judge Dredd games.


A Job Well Done


Rewards for RuneQuest.


The Cult of Myrddin


Working for the wizard in RuneQuest Slaine.


Kizen, Part 1


The first part of an extended look at kizen powers, from the unreleased supplement Soul and Steel.


Prophet, Adventurer, Warder


The first in a short series of Aldryami Addenda to coincide with the release of the Elfs book.


The Pits Where Mad Things Drum


Dark woods, an ancient sorcerer and foaming blasphemies drumming wildly in the shadows. A Conan adventure.

58563.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 50 - Nov 2007)
58563.description:
In this issue:


The World According to Roleplaying


The gunpowder plot, as enacted by a group of clueless roleplayers.


RuneQuest: Wondrous Materials


A selection of magical materials for crafting special items with.


WARS: Kizen, Part 2


Two more kizen trees from the unpublished supplement, Soul and Steel.


Glorantha: The Elder Wilds


The second Aldryami Addendum, introducing a fourth elf forest to supplement the three in Elfs.


Conan: Healers and Gladiators


Two new classes for Conan the Roleplaying Game.


Elric: Younger Kingdoms Explored


A look at two lesser-known kingdoms from the Elric saga.


Paranoia: The Table


In Alpha Complex, no one will admit to hearing you scream.

58564.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 51 - Dec 2007)
rpgissuearticle: I Didn't Realise That Violin Was Loaded
58564.description:
In this issue:


CthulhuTech: The Saga of CthulhuTech


From concept to printing, the story behind The Product That Didn’t Want To Be.


The State of the Mongoose


Matthew Sprange looks at where we are and where we’re going. Also, there is a picture of a hat.


Spycraft: I Didn’t Realise That Violin Was Loaded


How to design gadgets in Spycraft: from the ever-popular bladed hat to a motorbike that turns into a suit.


RuneQuest: Legendary Swords


Excalibur got all the press, but there are plenty of other swords of legend that your characters can emulate or steal.


WARS: Kizen, Part 3


The last part of the epic serialisation of Soul and Steel. The very last kizen tree: Matter Creation.


Glorantha: The Voralans


The paranoia doesn’t have to end when the mission does; now you have to account for your actions.


Spycraft: Once More Into the Breach


Spycraft combat examined and explored. You might want to bring that bladed hat from earlier...

58565.description:
Panic Tower! is a family game in which players must place wooden blocks and form towers.

On a game board with nine colors, each turn a player must place some wooden blocks vertically on one color and form towers with them. The blocks come in three heights, and which blocks and which colors you have to use are shown on a action card the player takes at the beginning of his turn.

If one or more of the towers fall because of that player's action, he receives a negative point. After removing fallen blocks, the next player takes her turn. Receive three negative points, and you're out of the game.
58565.name: Panic Tower!

58566.name: Enchanted Worlds Starter Kit
58566.description:
User summary

The Enchanted Worlds Starter Kit is a boxed set containing the Enchanted Worlds rules and an adventure. The front and back cover are printed sheets glued to the box.

The box includes:

- 34-page spiral-bound rulebook
- 20-page adventure "Autumn Harvest"
- a reference cardstock sheet
- a full-color map of the game world
- 2 character sheets
- a "Read this first" sheet
- a hand-knitted woolen dice bag with 2d10.


From the back of the book

Welcome to Unlond!

It is a time of danger and intrigue in a land of power and magic. Let this be your guide to the secrets within.

Ages ago, war engulfed the world of Unlond in an epic conflict. For long years an alliance of humans, elves and dwarves fought against the evil forces of the Dark Prince Tidur. Finally, the Dark Prince was struck down on the field of battle and his forces withdrew to their homelands. Now, centuries later, the embers of that war still burn in the hearts of many. Peace has never been more than just a stalemate between the forces of evil and the alliance that opposes them.

Ill omens abound now. A plague swept through the northern lands last winter, weakening the nations of the alliance. Strange creatures have been sighted and sages fear that war will return to Unlond. Now is the time for heros, for new legends and new stories of valor and diplomacy to be made. Now is the time for you to experience the power and magic of Enchanted Worlds

In this game of fantasy roleplaying you and your friends take on the roles of heros fighting against the forces of evil and treachery. Each player has a character, your hero that you roleplay. One person must take on the role of the gamemaster, who is responsible for creating the storyline, describing the setting of the adventure to the players and interpreting the rules.

The rules are easy to learn and quick to use. Each player spends points to raise the character's Attributes, eight scores that represent the character's innate abilities. Players then pick Skills for their characters. There are dozens of Skills to choose from. Any combination is possible, from a sneaky fighter to a sword-wielding wizard to an expert hunter or anything else you can imagine. Each character is as unique as each player.

Inside this box you'll find the complete rules for playing Enchanted Worlds games, a sample character sheet that can be photocopied for player use, a reference card with all the most commonly used charts and tables and a full color 11" x 17" map of Unlond.The game also includes two eight sided dice (all the dice needed for playing the game) with a special dice bag and Autumn Harvest the first adventure for the Seasons of Change storyline. The adventure has four sample characters, so you can play now without needing to make new characters.

Perhaps most importantly, the Enchanted Worlds Starter Kit is part of the New Worlds Game System. After you learn the rules of Enchanted Worlds, you'll be able to pick up either Distant Worlds (our science fiction setting), Fantastic Worlds (science-fantasy) or any other setting when they become available and begin to play immediately!

58567.name: Von eigenen Gnaden
58567.description:
(user summary)
This campaign installs the PCs as warrior kings in a war zone of the empire Mittelreich called Wildermark.
They have to stabilize the reagion by diplomacy with the neighboring warrior kings, ruling their region with justice (or a strong fist), fulfilling some quests and of course by warfare.
This campaign is highly unusual for the Das Schwarze Auge roleplaying game as it pitches the player in positions of power.

58568.name: NeverWorld
rpgissuearticle: Role-Playing Reviews - Big games from little companies
58568.description:
From the back of the book

One of the FEW Books of True Fantasy you'll ever need.

We, you and I, live in a sliver of time somwhere in the Third Age. Until now, our nation has lived in cultural isolation. Once, isolation was the key to our survival. Now, the scent of change is on the winds, and the key to survival is knowledge. Each culture on this world has its own secrets in which may lie the key to our continued survival. Along the way there will be danger, monsters, challenges and rewards beyond counting. This is NeverWorld, and it is waiting for your fresh footprint...

The R.O.C. and Roll system!

Combat: realistic with speed, or reflexively advanced!
Hourani book contains Wizardry Magic, the first of 14 schools.
Detailed powers of religious Followers, Champions and Leaders
10 spheres of Metaphysics and an introduction to MetaWorld.
10 step character generation, with all the trimmings!
Monsters can beat you like you stole their cookies...
Every risk taken leads to 8+ possibilities using the Rolling Outcome Chart.
More important than what you do, is why you do it, and who sees you.
Forge up to 12 Masteries for your character from the elements of 120+ skills.
Designed for three types of gamers: Cerebral, Casual and Craftor.
Gamble the results of your character's actions to gain fortune & glory.
Brings your fantasies to life in a virtual environment.
Tweak your career choice with skills from any other profession.
All rules are easily tailored to enhance the GM's style.




This Boxed Set includes:

The Tome of NeverWorld rulebook
Culturebook: Hourani supplement
The NeverWorld GM's Screen
22"x32" Full Color Map
2 custom-printed NeverWorld post-it style notes
10 sided dice




The only True Fantasy Role Playing Game
Players search for individual answers to their existence, and group together for exciting adventure. The "Game Master" tells the interactive story which you can act upon at any moment! This is a game where science will never be more than a mystery, and myth is your key to survival. Every situation you face requires risk, every risk has it's rewards.

After you open the box....
Use the Quick Rules to generate your character in about a half hour. Select your subculture, masteries, and resources.

...find out where you're going and what you need...
Each culture has their own supplies, tools, weapons, armors, services and luxuries. Purchase what you need. Indulge in what you want.

..then choose or lose.
The culture that surrounds you is afraid to risk the unknown. You are one of the few who sees more to life. Learn to survive in your own terrain, from city streets to outbound wilds. Watch for opportunities from mysterious figures, follow the road less travelled, beware the easy reward. Stay true to your Pathway and you will not fail! Let others make your decisions and you will not live...

58569.name: Dragon (Issue 316 - Feb 2004)
rpgissuearticle: Cloak and Dagger - Gears, Gadgets, and Gizmos for your game
DM's Toolbox - Character Intelligence vs Player Intelligence
Elminter's Guide to the Realms - The Black Dwarf Mine
Hecate's Ring: Crusader Earth - The Chalice of Life #2
License to Kill - Players in the Great Game
Scale Mail - Dragons, Dwarves, and a Squid
Smoke and Mirrors - Divinations in D&D
Spies Like Us - Stealth for Stumblers
Up on a Soapbox - The Spell Gone Awry
58569.description:
40+ Pages of Tactics, Techniques, and Tools to make you a Master Spy

Vol. XXVII, No. 9
Cover art by James Ryman (his first time!)

58570.name: Glückskäfer
58570.description: The players have suction hammers, going after cardboard chips which are face-down on the table. When they hit a chip so it is sucked to the hammer, they can check which color it is. If it matches their own ladybug puzzle, they can take it and go for the next one. The first player to find his or her six chips is the winner.

58571.name: Hänsel und Gretel
58571.description:
Hänsel and Gretel have to move around the gingerbread house and over a bridge to get home. The witch has to catch Hänsel and get back to her house; if Gretel catches her in the meantime, the kids win. If the kids manage to reach the bridge, they also win. Movement is determined by dice. With three players, one plays Hänsel, one Gretel and one the witch; with two players, one of them moves both Hänsel and Gretel.

The game is equipped with beautiful materials; trees, a house, etc., which can be set up any way the players like.

58572.name: Dungeon (Issue 100 - Jul 2003) / Polyhedron (Issue 159)
58572.description:
Volume XVII Number 4
"Collector's Issue"
180-Page Super-Spectacular

Cover by Wayne Reynolds
Polyhedron cover by Wayne Reynolds

The two issues are printed back-to-back; one side has a Dungeon front cover, and if you turn the magazine upside-down, you see a Polyhedron front cover.

Issue quote:
"You never told him? Never told him what was in the letter Dumbledore left fer him? I was there! I saw Dumbledore leave it, Dursley! An' you've kept it from him all these years?"

"Kept what from me?" said Harry eagerly.

"STOP! I FORBID YOU!" yelled Uncle Vernon in panic.

Aunt Petunia gave a gasp of horror.

"Ah, go boil yer heads, both of yeh," said Hagrid. "Harry - yer a wizard."

--J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

58573.name: Hochstapeln
58573.description: Players roll dice to determine how many pieces they have to stack on a tower. The dice have numbers from 1 to 3; on a 2 one can decide to challenge an opponent who has to stack one's own pieces or roll a two to defeat the challenge. The first player to run out of pieces gets 50 points; when the tower collapses, the player who caused it gets as many negative points as there were pieces inside.

58574.name: M.I.G Familj
58574.description: A compact trivia game, consisting of a deck of cards. The family version of M.I.G. contains 780 questions for adults and 780 questions for kids between 7 and 13 years.

58576.description:
The game consists of a large cardboard house with a chimney. Some chickens are put on the stove under the chimney. The players insert fishing rods with magnets through the chimney to get the chickens, without actually being able to see anything (the house is open to the other side, but not on the players' side. The chickens count different points, the player with most points is the winner.

The theme refers to Wilhelm Busch's classic poem/story "Max und Moritz".
58576.name: Hühnerschmaus

58577.name: Our Ladies of Sorrow
58577.description:
From the publisher:

Our Ladies of Sorrow

In this modern day campaign of supernatural horror, the investigators encounter The Sorrows -- ancient goddesses of grief, madness, and death who, in their multitude of forms, have preyed on Man since he first began to dream. These lengthy scenarios mix elements of ghost stories and mythology and emphasize subtle atmospheric horror and terror on a very personal level. For as the investigators strip away their foes' many masks, they themselves become the prey of The Sorrows, culminating in a terrible choice that could save their lives -- but leave them forever haunted by their grim sacrifice...

58578.name: Jackpot
58578.description: Dice rolling game in which the players pay one chip to be able to roll three dice. For one of the winning combinations they get 1-5 chips, for three "bar" symbols, they get the whole pot. The last player with chips is the winner.

58579.name: Dungeon (Issue 116 - Nov 2004)
rpgissuearticle: The 30 Greatest D&D Adventures of All Time
Campaign Workbook: The City - Abandoned Buildings
Campaign Workbook: The Dungeon - Four Fiendish Fountains
Dungeoncraft: Mastering the Game - Starting a New Campaign (Part 3)
Wil Save 3: The Search for Fun
58579.description:
Volume 18 Number 11

Cover by sculptor Dave Studer

Issue quote:
"Deep in the primaeval swamps of Lake Gloomey, shrouded in perpetual mists, lies the city of The Brothers of the Swamp. For years past this "religious" order has delved into the forbidden areas of study and determined that animals have more potential to populate the world than man, who was, after all, a biological abomination which would ultimately threaten the existence of all life."
--Dave Arneson, The Temple of the Frog

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

58580.name: Space Rat: The Jack Cosmos Adventure Game!
rpg: Space Rat: The Jack Cosmos Adventure Game!
58580.description:
From the introduction:

At last! A role playing game based on your favourite intergalactic anti-hero, Jack Cosmos - the Space Rat. You’ve read of his cheesy escapades in the international best selling novels, you’ve seen his devious antics on the nationally syndicated television series, and collected the spring-loaded glow-in-the-dark action figures. Now you can take part in his outrageous adventures too! Suit up and prepare for action -you’re about to join the Space Rat’s cadre of needy girlfriends, the Femme Babes, as they set out on another wild ride across the universe!

In Space Rat: the Jack Cosmos Adventure Game! players become members of the Femme Babes, helping Jack on his adventures in the hope that he will pay them a little extra attention. As a Femme Babe you will have to work with the other girls to complete the mission, but at the same time you want to make sure no one upstages you!

This game has been created in twenty-fourhours. A single, continuous rotation of the insignificant planet Earth around its pale yellow sun. That’s why I included all those bits it turns out you didn’t like.
It has also been created as my entry in the Ronnies. I took for my inspiration the words Rat and Girlfriend.

58581.name: Dragon (Issue 315 - Jan 2004)
58581.description:
Dragon Magazine
Volume XXVIII No. 8
Issue 315
January 2004

Campaign Classics

Cover Art by Dan Scott

58582.name: Dragon (Issue 314 - Dec 2003)
58582.description:
Dragon Magazine
Volume XXVIII No. 7
Issue 314
December 2003

Elemental Magic

Cover Art by Arnie Swekel

58583.name: Nils Holgerssons underbara resa genom Sverige
58583.description: A roll and move game based on the Swedish Nobel Prize winner Selma Lagerlöf's (1858-1940) novel "The wonderful adventures of Nils" (sw. 1906-07, eng. 1910).

58584.name: Dragon (Issue 313 - Nov 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Faiths of Faerun - Elder Serpents of Set
Guild Secrets: The Reapers of Strife
58584.description:
Dragon Magazine
Volume XXVIII, No. 6
Issue 313
November 2003

Races of Power

Cover art by Wayne Reynolds

58585.description:
In LEGO® City, the Road Rescue crew is always on the job! These hard-working expert mechanics help out drivers in trouble, repairing their damaged vehicles on the spot or towing them to the big garage to get fixed up.

Do you have what it takes to be a Road Rescue mechanic? Challenge your friends in a race to the Garage, helping out LEGO City's citizens along the way!
(- from the publisher's summary)

This basic children's roll-and-move game appears in the September-October 2009 issue of LEGO Brickmaster Magazine. The board is printed on pages 14 and 15 of the magazine, and consists of a simple track of spaces (some with instructions) amidst imagery of sets from LEGO's 2009 City "Road Rescue" theme; the instructions appear in a sidebar next to the gameboard. LEGO elements are specified to be used as the player pieces and the die.
58585.name: LEGO City: Road Rescue Game!

58586.name: The Last Human
58586.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

The Last Human is a role playing game that was created in 24 hours. Why 24 hours? Why not. It’s a challenge, and one that this writer took up with gusto. I have made some assumptions while writing, like you know what a role playing game is, or what a d6 is. If you don’t, stop reading right now and find out.

If you do know what I’m on about, grab a pencil, some paper and a few d6; gather your friends; and prepare for an outrageous ride!


The Last Human is a sweeping space opera set in a mysterious galaxy filled with strange planets, ferocious aliens, and a terrible menace.

A thousand years ago mankind set out for the stars, intent on making a better life for themselves. Aboard the great space arc Utopia they thought to travel to a distant galaxy where they might make a better life for themselves, away from the pollution, tyranny and death that had overrun Earth.

But these bold colonists were to fall foul to an enemy within, betrayed by their greatest technological achievement - the android. These soulless humanoids, convinced of their superiority over man, plotted while their creators slept in cryogenic hibernation. When the time was right, they turned off the hibernation safety protocols, killing all those who slept.

Or so they thought.

The androids then spread into the galaxy themselves, abandoning the Utopia to an icy voyage through time and space.

But one human survived. Now the Utopia’s sentient computer, Main Frame, and the robots programmed for menial labour have the mammoth task of protecting the last human from all the hazards of deep space. And from the androids, who are intent on finishing the job they had started.

And who is this last survivor of the human race? A child. An infant girl. Her name is Eve.


Game Concept and Design
Nathan Russell

Inspiration - Film and Literature
Lost In Space, The Black Hole, Monsters Inc., ABC Warriors, Ice Pirates, Star Wars, Tarzan, Red Dwarf, The Flintstones, The Jetsons, Star Trek, Thunder Cats

Inspiration - Games
Paranoia, Star Wars (by WEG)

58587.name: Gold Train
58587.description:
Gold Train (aka. Train Wreck) is dice game where a player's score is recorded on a single peg track. Five dice are rolled, and points are awarded ones, fives, 3 or more of a kind, and straights. Several places along the track award bonus points. You may roll multiple times per turn, increasing your distance by accumulating past roll scores, but if you roll a "derail" (a non-scorable roll), you stay put instead of advancing. You can send your opponent backwards if you "rob" their train with dice instead of guns, and hope you prevail, or YOU go backwards instead!
Clever game that is easy to learn.

58588.name: Space Rat: The Jack Cosmos Adventure Game! (Extra Cheesy Edition!)
rpg: Space Rat: The Jack Cosmos Adventure Game!
58588.description:
From the back of the book:

Become a Femme babe!
Save the galaxy!
Win Jack's heart!

At last! A roleplaying game about your favourite intergalactic anti-hero. Jack Cosmos - the Space Rat.

Now you can take part in his over the top, outrageous adventures too!

Suit up and prepare for action - you're about to join the Space Rat's cadre of needy girlfriends, the femme babes, as they set out on another wild ride across the galaxy!

The Space Rat rules are a wonder of clarity and intertwined, logical design. Femme Babes are bad-asses with style! At the end of the session, both players beaned and said, "I like my Femme Babe," as if they hadn't expected to. - Ron Edwards

58589.name: Book of the Machine
58589.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Since the dawn of the Champions Universe, the fiendish robot Mechanon has been trying to exterminate all organic life on Earth - and only the might and valor of the world’s heroes has stopped him. The Book Of The Machine is a detailed look at Mechanon, covering everything from his alternate forms to his hidden lairs, his robotic minions, and his many schemes to rid the Earth of organic infestations.

58590.name: Champions Worldwide
58590.description:
Publisher Blurb:

SUPERHUMANS AROUND THE WORLD

The United States may have a major share of superhumans in the Champions Universe, but it’s not the only place you can find heroes and villains. Every continent has plenty of costumed criminals and crimefighters of its own, ranging from people with trivial abilities to those with the power to shake the world. Champions Worldwide is your guide to superheroes and supervillains from outside the United States. Featuring over seventy new characters, plus information on the current state of the Superhuman World in each continent or region, it covers:

—Europe (excluding the British Isles)
—Russia and the former Soviet Union states
—the Middle East
—Africa
—India
—Eastern Asia (including China and Japan)
—Australia and Oceania
—Mexico, Central and South America, and the Caribbean

No matter where your Champions campaign takes your characters, Champions Worldwide has plenty of exciting new adversaries and allies for them to meet!

58591.name: Verge
58591.description:
From the back of the book:

the wind whispers through the streets
who is keeton?

Verge a fantasypunk game

From the Introduction of the book:

Verge is a fantasy roleplaying game of action, violence, conspiracy, attitude and adventure. It is a game of little people in a big city, doing what they can to survive in a world where a lot more is going on than they are ever likely to know or understand.

58592.name: White Wolf Magazine (Issue 46 - Jun 1994)
rpgissuearticle: The Assault of the Rampaging Dust Bunnies
58592.description:
In this issue:


Runes (Ken Cliffe)
From the Pack
Industry Wired (Teeuwynn)
Howling at the Moon
The Magic of Jyhad (Rob McMillon)
The Other Sword (Robert Weinberg)
Feature Review: Nephilim (Steve Perrin)
The Assault of the Rampaging Dust Bunnies

Artist Spotlight: Brom
Tattoos and You
Capsule Reviews
Gladiator Cow, Part 2 of 3 (Chris Painter)
Top Twenty List
On the Horizon

58593.name: Vignette
58593.description:
From the introduction of the book:

Vignette is a role playing game (or RPG, as we say) of immense proportions and stupefying simplicity, designed to allow you to create exciting stories in any setting imaginable, with a minimum of
fuss, or even preparation.
Vignette is first and foremost an easy game. The guidelines and suggestions within this book have been designed to allow players to move from the thought ’lets role play in this setting...’ to actually
playing within a matter of minutes. The character design system is quick and intuitive, allowing you to play any kind of character you desire, and the dice mechanics are easy to learn, and very simple to use.
Vignette is also universal. Or generic. Or whatever you want to call it. These core rules are not wrapped around a specific background or setting, and make an effort to assume nothing. It is a basic system around which you may create your own settings and stories. You will find Vignette offers a wide range of choices for you to customise the game to your preferred style of play, and more than enough room for you to add your own ideas.

58594.description:
Eight desert scenarios for ASL, designed by ASL News designers.

Contains the following scenarios:

EP14: Indian Sacrifice
EP15: The Pursuit
EP20: Across the Wire
EP36: Before the Ghibli Comes
EP71: Out of the Sand
EP29a: A Push in the Bush
DYO X9: No Time for Love
EP71bis: The Sequel
58594.name: Euro Pack IV: War in North Africa

58595.name: Signs & Portents - Roleplayer Edition (Issue 52 - Jan 2008)
rpgissuearticle: The Ichthus of Life, Part I
The Right Tools for the Right Job
58595.description:
In this issue:


RuneQuest: Camel Spiders


A one-page creature feature dedicated to the wailing arachnids of the desert.


OGL: Maintaining Mortality


The winner of the Colour Slaine Competition, an article about making combat more dangerous.


Spycraft: The Right Tools for the Right Job


If you ever wondered what the perfect kit for killing someone – in Spycraft – was, this article has the answers.


Babylon 5: The Halfway House


A penal colony turned black market paradise. Find adventure in a seedy sector of space.


RuneQuest: Summoners


If you have ever wanted to add a bit of Final Fantasy to your RuneQuest, here’s how.


Conan: The Ark of Delight


A sailing brothel and drug den for Hyborian adventurers to partake of or demolish, depending on mood.


Hawkmoon: The Ichthus of Life, Part 1


The opening movements of a scenario for Hawkmoon, featuring a magic fish and some Frenchmen.


Paranoia: New Initiatives


A new year in Alpha Complex sees ever more and better ways to make Friend Computer happy.

58596.description:
Originally published as ASL News Pack 1, Euro Pack I contains 8 scenarios that expand the Advanced Squad Leader Rule Book system. These scenarios originally were published in the European ASL newsletter, "ASL News." This was the first of several scenario packs that reprinted ASL News scenarios. In these packs, the scenarios were grouped into themes (in this one, for example, the scenarios are all early war actions taking place during 1939-1941).*

The ASL News Pack contains the following scenarios:

1. 19 First Contact, First Defeat

- North of MLAWA, POLAND, 1 September 1939
- Polish elements of the 20th Infantry Division
- German elements of Panzer Regiment 7 and 11th Infantry Division
- Mapboards 17 and 33 required

1. 21 The Shortest Way

- KALININ, RUSSIA, 14 October 1941
- Russian elements of the Moscow AA Defenses and Kalinin Factory Workers
- German elements of the 1st company Kradschutzen Battalion 1 and 3rd company, 1 Schutzen Regiment 113
- Mapboards 8, 20, 21 and 23 required

1. 48 For One More Hour

- CRUPET, BELGIUM, 12 May 1940
- French 5th Mixt Escadron, 14th RDP, 4th DLC
- German elements of the 5th Panzer Division and MG Battalion 8
- Mapboards 11 and 41 required

1. 25 Under Fire

- PILATKA-ILZA, POLAND, 9 September 1939
- Polish elements of the 163rd "KOP" Infantry Regiment, 36th Division
- German elements of the 9th Schutzen-Regiment, 3rd Leichte Division
- Mapboard 18 required

1. 41 Objective Princehage

- PRINCEHAGE, HOLLAND 13 May 1940
- French Detachement de decouverte du Capialine Lelievre, lere DLM
- German elements of Kompanie 1, SR 11, 9th Panzer Division
- Mapboards 10, 17 and 33 required

1. 42 Welcome to Vietnam

- NA CHAM PORT, INDOCHINA 24 September 1940
- Japanese elements of the 5th Division
- French elements of 10eme Compagnie, III/9eme R.I.C.
- Mapboards 36 and 37 required

1. 43 Salamanders Into the Flames

- FLAVION, BELGIUM, 15 May 1940
- German elements of Battalion 1, Panzer Regiment 31, 5th Panzer Division
- French 2eme Compagnie, 37eme BCC, lere DLM
- Mapboards 2, 11, and 18 required

1. 8 Motorcycles at Zjitomir

- ZJITOMIR, RUSSIA, 8 July 1941
- German 2nd Company, 43rd Kradschutzen Battalion, 13th Panzer Division
- Russian elements of the Zjitomir Training and Recruitment Center attached to the 5th Army
- Mapboards 10 and 17 required

* Summary Source: Mark Pitcavage, Desperation Morale.

http://www.desperationmorale.com/worldofasl/worldcrithit4.ht...
58596.name: Euro Pack I: Early War Actions
